Reviews.Title: “repeat visitor cannot say enough good”
Reviews.Author: Mica M
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at the hotel du parc four times now for 1-2 weeks each visit. i cannot say enough good things about the hotel and the location. spotlessly clean. lovely staff. nice modern decor. sort of like a boutique hotel but not boutique hotel prices. such good value for money. yes the rooms are a bit small but this is paris. yes a bit off the beaten tourist track but for me that is a plus. the neighborhood is extremely lively--numerous cafes, restaurants and cinemas at your doorstep. metro stations and many bus lines at your doorstep--and if you are a big walker as i am one can walk easily to latin quarter, st. germain, musee d'orsay, invalides, tour eiffel.... if you can master the buses, easy to do with a proper bus map, the location becomes even better. the breakfast buffet is just lovely, although a bit pricey so i often ate at a nearby cafe. nice to have CNN and free internet and computer available. note there is a lift, but not for the one flight from the street level to the lobby level.

Reviews.Title: “A must,very nice and personal!”
Reviews.Author: colette b
Reviews.Content: The hotel du Parc is close to Montparnasse Metro station and 2min walking distance to TGV train Station. All the staff were very friendly, the bed and pillows were very comfortable and the curtains really do cut out the light Very good American breakfast with eggs , pancakes and fresh fruit salad. We only used the room to sleep, but they do have a nice flat-screen TV with access to a few English-language stations. They also have free Wi-Fi service, if you bring your laptop. A free Mac can be used in the lobby. The room was spotlessly cleaned, and the staff was very helpful. The rooms are a little cozy, but are very clean and tidy. I would return in Hotel Du Parc for next trip in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: This was a nice clean hotel centrally located in Paris and it was easy to hop onto public transportation and the tourist buses. The staff were helpful and spoke English and a light breakfast was included in the fees which was nice. There are some cute restaurants within walking distance and an amazing authentic Crepe place nearby. It was clean but definitely VERY small, which is to be expected in Paris. Overall, we had a fine experience here, but would probably stay elsewhere when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & safe but could be better value”
Reviews.Author: JoeB79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Years 2012. While we found the location to be good and there were plenty of amazing creperies nearby (worth checking out) we where disappointed to book the hotel a few months in advance, only for the price per room to be less if we had booked on arrival. The hotel is clean and beds comfortable but there was a problem with the free wifi so it didn't work for our visit. Not bad for Paris but it is a bit away from main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Luckett79
Reviews.Content: Although small, the rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Good value in a good location. Would stay here again. Close to many restaurants and metro. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “There is no park,and not first floor”
Reviews.Author: tomas r
Reviews.Content: This hotel du parc misrepresented itself. It is not one flight of stairs to the elevator but three. It is not by the park but near the cemetery. The park referred to is a plot of sorry looking grass with a rickety horse with spring. People are sleeping by the sidewalk. The front desk all around guy was rude. When I informed him that my mother couldnt possibly climb the stairs, so steep because of her knee... The very reason why I asked if they had a lift and if they were ground level... The guy refused to refund what he took out from our card even if we couldn't use the room because my mother could not climb the stairs. From resident Foch, this was a dump. Misleading. I reported the matter to the authorities and am waiting for word. Never trust the guy who emails back. I should have known when none of the booing sites carried them. Do not be mislead...it was just so unfortunate that we wanted accomodations near the train station for our train. ... When we left the place we thankfully found a place fronting gallery Lafayette... This place is dangerous and what they say about the service seems untrue... II remember when we were asking for the police number he was like..why should I give it to you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,very good value,better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in hotel du Parc Montparnasse. The hotel itself was situated in the full center of Montparnasse district,with Edgar Quinet station 1 min walking.The room was very clean and quiet,situated in top floor of the building.Front desk opened 24h a day, was very helpfull;there was free wifi in the room,and the breakfast was excellent for the price:12€(A single coffee costs around 3€ in bars nearby!). Would definitely return here for next trip

Reviews.Title: “Very good for central Paris”
Reviews.Author: artemisworks
Reviews.Content: We rated this hotel by its relatively low price and the fact that it was in central Paris, and you don't generally get good rooms in Paris unless you pay an arm and a leg! This hotel is very conveniently located if you need to be close to the Gare Montparnasse - it is about a 5 minute walk and about 10 minutes to the main train station. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, and indeed you have to carry your luggage up a flight of stairs to the tiny reception hall, but the rooms themselves are a decent size (for Paris) and freshly refurbished, so everything is clean and new. There is also free wifi available. Its location also makes it convenient for numerous restaurants and cafes which are just a stone's throw from the hotel. The beds were comfortable and it was quiet at night, so all in all, I would come back here if I had to book a hotel near Gare Montparnasse again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Great location”
Reviews.Author: mjrdzine
Reviews.Content: This place taught me the value of choosing a hotel near a metro hub. We were never had to change metro lines more than once to get back to the hotel. The Hotel itself is clean and very nice for the price. As i've said in another review, if you're expecting an American style hotel for 90 euro a night you need to adjust your expectations. We had a room with a double bed and a single bed. There were 3 of us in there for 4 nights and with our 3 large bags, 3 small bags, and 3 back packs it was pretty full. But it's not the hotels fault we brought too much luggage. My only real issue was the extreme firmness of the mattress. But after a 12 to 14 hour day of walking around Paris i slept like a log any way. The staff was very nice and gave very helpful advice regarding the best routes and times to visit the places i inquired about. There are many cafes in the area and hidden across the street is a full on super grocery store. (think one of the super targets) If i return to Paris i will certainly be inquiring about vacancies here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: angela d
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean in a good location. We found the front desk staff to be friendly and ready to offer suggestions. The rooms are small by US standards, but there were plenty of places to store things. As others have stated, the metro is 5 minutes away and there are plenty of great places to eat. I suggest paying for the breakfast as it is comparable to what is available in the neighborhood and offers a good selection. Also, know that there is a Monoprix nearby in case you need anything. Finally, do not let the exterior scare you when you come up. The small lobby and rooms are fine!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value for the money..will be back”
Reviews.Author: FranglishTay
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that was within walking distance from Montparnasse station. It is a 3 to 5 minute walk depending on how many bags you have. The hotel is like many Paris hotels, compact but the rooms were clean and I had someplace to rest my head everynight. The neighbourhood is great with loads of restaurants within walking distance. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: SammyUgg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice, safe part of the Latin Quarter with many pubs, cafes and restaurants nearby. The metro station Edgar Quinet is 2 minutes away, thus making this hotel a great base for exploring Paris. The hotel staff are very helpful and kind. The rooms, although somewhat small (which is normal for Paris), are very clean and tidy. The rooms were obviously renovated recently and are very elegant. I will definitely visit this hotel next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: slcheng
Reviews.Content: It is close to Metro Montparnasse and Montparnasse tower. It located behind supermarket MONOPRIX and facing a small triangle park. Many local restaurants and great cafe shops around the hotel. The room is tiny and comfortable, the staff was kind and helpful. It is a good choice for Paris tour. The only inconvenience thing is that the front desk is not on grond floor and no elevator. We have to climb up stair hardly with our heavy luggages. If you have a lot of heavy luggages, there are other better hotels around it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, clean, convenient with very helpful staff'”
Reviews.Author: brokenspokes2010
Reviews.Content: Great value, well-located and staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need”
Reviews.Author: Chardy999
Reviews.Content: Perfect room for a base. Clean and comfortable. Short walk to metro then into city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SMinihane
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Paris for the first time in 2010 treated my girlfriend for her birthday. Booked duparc after reading reviews on here. After finding it we were checked in by a lovely man and woman who i believe are the owners of the hotel. Just a word of warning their are a fair few steps upto reception. Anyways we were promptly checked in and went up to our room to unwind after travelling. The room was small but really nicely decorated and had everything you could need eg hair dryer hot water showers etc. I liked it even though paris rooms are small they managed to do as much as they could with it and it felt cosy. Sleeping in the room was a pleasure there was no noise the bed was soft and comfy and we had some great sleeps. We went sight seeing as you do in Paris and as we hadnt a clue where anything was we enquired at the desk. The lady whos name escapes me (shes the owner) couldnt have been more helpful giving us a map, tips on where to visit (including getting off the metro at the stop after the eiffel tower and getting a magnificent view). She also was able to book a resturaunt for us, arrange anything we needed advise us on disney etc. She was fantastic and we cant speak highly enough of her. Always smiling and happy and greeting guests with a warmth you dont get most places. Overall hotel duparc have managed to do a lot with the little space they have and their arent much i can fault it with. If i had to nit pick the elevator is a bit small and 1 person with bags can only fit in it but again this is a space issue in a huge city and they have done well. Excellent hotel that i would recommend to anybody and we will definetely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilshoppinggal
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this was our first trip to France and we were not aware of how SMALL the hotel rooms can be. Wow!! -- these rooms are TINY! Seriously, we could basically touch the walls on each side while lying on the bed. Of course there is an equally tiny bathroom too. Hotel du Parc was well located - very near a lot of restaurants, and public transport. Though there was the odd street person sleeping near the hotel, the Montparnasse area felt safe and quite secure. Front desk was there for us as we struggled with our French and navigated the city by metro. Many thanks for your helpful directions and our lack of preparation in learning the language. Merci! The hotel, though in a busier, bustling area, remained quiet and we felt well rested each night. The only negatives that I might have for this establishment is that it is a bit expensive (but we also learned that PARIS is expensive!) and we had a heinous odour emanating from somewhere in our bathroom on our return to our room on the 3rd day of our 5-day stay. We did notify the gentleman at the desk that night, but were informed that he could not help us as the day staff would need to be notified. The smell was not investigated the next day, but was sooo bad by then that we had to close the bathroom door and leave the window open in order to cope. Having a shower in the stench was a challenge. If I had to guess, it smelled like a sewage leak somewhere. The smell issue aside, I would still return to this hotel on a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EmilieVoyage
Reviews.Content: What can I say...this hotel is just the place to go when you have a business (or tourism) trip to plan in Paris. Rooms have a lovely decoration and all are different so, each stay is a nice moment. It's quiet, confortable and really close from Montparnasse Bienvenue Station that is really a very good advantage.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny oasis in Paris, felt safe.”
Reviews.Author: SexyBoots339
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, and it is very nice. Bit pricey, but is very nice. It's a 5 minute walk from the Gare Montparnasse (Renne, Nantes, Angers, Le Mons) and the Montparnasse Metro stop (4 lines, all go straight into the cultural heart of Paris). The Edward Quinet stop of the Parisian Metro is about 3 minutes away (only serves Line 6), and that corner is full of little brasseries and crèperies. L'Hotel du Parc is a little, tiny oasis in Paris. The staff is very good, very funny, and want to help (carry heavy bags, perfect a pronunciation, give directions, recommend a good restaurant). It has free WiFi, and a very good closed circuit system. Must turn in the card key when leaving (remember your room number in French, it really helps). The helpful staff knew who I was when I stayed for 4 nights, and would hand me my card key before I was at the top of the stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Good Rates, Decent Sized Room for Paris & Price”
Reviews.Author: kiki713
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the Hotel du Parc, one for July 7th and one for July 18th, my arrival and departure nights for my trip to France. For me, the location is ideal, as I take the train to my parent's house in Brittany from the Gare Montparnasse. I was intrigued by the pictures on the hotel website and read all the reviews. I think if you're used to large, American-sized hotel rooms, you will not like any hotel in Europe, where the rooms tend to be much smaller unless you're staying at a 150 euros and up hotel. For the price, my room was perfect. They stick to the 2PM check-in time, so unless you want to book for the night before in order to have a nap, don't count on checking in early. There are two flights of stairs up to the reception desk, so if you have heavy bags, plan on a bit of a haul to get them up there. I had to make two trips, but the desk clerk was kind enough to help me down the stairs when I left. The rooms have hardwood floors and had nice lighting. The shower, although small, had great water pressure and was one of the best showers I've had in Paris, ever. And yes, the photos on the web site were definitely taken w/ a wide lens, but it really was a nice room for the money. Clean, good curtains (I took a nap in my very dark room), good hair dryer and tv, everything I could want. And only a 5-minute walk or less to the train station. There's also a Metro stop right around the corner. All in all, a great choice. Looking forward to my second stay tomorrow night. Try their web site for the best prices!! I booked one night on Parishotels.com and the other night directly on their web site and got a better rate on their own site.

Reviews.Title: “Less than the pictures imply”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlr2011
Reviews.Content: Really convenient location in Montparnasse, convenient to train station, Metro and Monoprix. Really jumping area for entertainment, food, drink and crepes around Place Josephine Baker and Rue Odessa. Reasonable rates, However, the hotel's location on tiny Rue Jolivet is a real downer. Vacant shops and rough sleepers don't help the ambience. Tiny rooms, tiny narrow hallways, two flights up to the tiny reception. Just enough decoration for the website pictures -- disappointing reality. Adequate bathroom with a good shower.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable billet”
Reviews.Author: Biggles-on-the-Fly
Reviews.Content: When attending a trade show, such as the Paris Air Show, whether as visitor or exhibitor, most people just require a clean room, a comfortable bed and en-suite ablutions. All this you get here at a competitive room rate (especially booking online), now with complimentry WiFi access. There are many bars and restaurants just a few steps away in and around Montparnasse. Like General MacArthur "I shall return".

Reviews.Title: “Very kind & helpful”
Reviews.Author: Pearl9grey
Reviews.Content: The owner couple were kind and thoughtful. they gave us the room early as we had just arrived jetlagged. Small room, yes, but quiet! Which I didn't expect so near the Montparnasse station. So near that my friend & I rolled our suitcases to catch the train. I had spilled my purse in the room and my passport fell out, unnoticed. I left for 4 days and went back to Hotel du Parc to pick up a suitcase that they allowed us to keep there they presented us with my passport!!! You can imagine my surprise and relief. Definitely recommend this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Jon5440
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed a two night stay at the Hotel du Parc. Overall, a great location. We were a bit apprehensive after reading some negative comments in a popular travel book about nearby rue de la Gaite, but upon arrival were very happy with what is really a good location - lots of nearby restaurants and bars, and very safe, even late. Great access to several nearby metro stops and a lively outdoor market (featuring some great artists this particular weekend). The hotel itself was nice - not luxurious by any stretch, but clean and friendly. Chantal and the rest of the staff went out of their way to make our daughter feel special on her birthday, even providing a small gift upon check-in. The room (a triple) wasn't huge but was fine for a few nights and at least had closet space for our luggage and clothing, which is better than in many similar places. There was a safe, free wi-fi (never tested) and the beds were comfy. No view from our room, but I appreciated the quiet courtyard after a late night with friends. We did breakfast one morning - nothing special, but enough choices, including eggs, cereal, pancakes, fruit and several breads and yogurts, that it seemed reasonable compared to the 7 euro cafe breakfasts in the surrounding neighborhood. Upon check-out, they were kind enough to hold our luggage for a few hours, and a only a block or two from the metro, pick-up later was easy. Overall, a good value for the money and we were glad to be introduced to a neighborhood we weren't previously familiar with. The walk to/from Jardin du Luxembourg was particularly nice. Thanks for helping make our weekend memorable without breaking the bank!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Parc was a great choice for my four nights in Paris - nice little road with restaurants around the corner - metro just a few blocks away - in room safe, a/c, nice bathroom, hardwood floors, very clean, only had the 12 euro breakfast the first morning, after that I went out, had a lovely 8 euro Breton petit dejeuner around the corner: fresh squeezed oj, cappuccino, buckwheat crepe with real dark chocolate (not Nutella)....felt very safe in the neighbourhood, came back to the hotel about 11pm alone every night....free use of computer at reception. Nice staff. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “terrific!”
Reviews.Author: MSBEExx
Reviews.Content: location was terrific, lietrarlly two minute walk to the mtero .. the neighbourhood was good, heaps of restaurants and other services nearby laundry, main station, cafes, restaurants, bars).. the room was alright considering how much it was .. it was clean, comfortable and was very satisfied with it all .. staff was very friendly and helpful in pointing us to the right directions (places to see, directions etc).. and we were always greeted with a friendly smile and 'bonjour' which i found very nice, unlike most staff from other places who just ignore you ... so defnitely recommend this hotel to everyone. cheap and affordable. good location. and excellent and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent area!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandGinfizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We found the rooms to be modern, clean and comfortable. Decent sized bathroom & good shower. The staff were very friendly & helpful. We didn't have breakfast as there are so many lovely cafes around the hotel for eating & drinking. Good access to the metro for touring the city. We were also able to leave our luggage with the hotel on the day we were leaving to go out and about as our flight was not until later in the day. The stairs may be a problem for people with walking difficulties or young families with prams/ buggies. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: dolphin041
Reviews.Content: hotel was definetly value for money. Very clean,good breakfast choice and helpful staff. Located near metro station, line for eiffel tower. Next to lots of lovely creperies

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sandrita2
Reviews.Content: After a long flight we were happy to get an early check-in. Our standard room was small but cozy, good lighting and wifi signal, bathroom adequate and both spotless clean. A tiny lift from the 1st floor to the rooms for the luggage.Charming and very helpful staff and owners, good buffet breakfast with selection of breads, cereals, cheeses, coldcuts and more. We liked the location, a supermarket nearby, many cafe's, restaurants, quaint streets, train and metro stations within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - cleanliness/courteous/convenient”
Reviews.Author: cnovak_11
Reviews.Content: We used trip advisor to find this hotel. The hotel is conveniently located a block from the Montparnasse train station as well as half a block from the #6 metro and two blocks from the #12. The hotel staff were very friendly and extremely helpful answering our numerous questions. The room was small but that is standard in Paris. It was very clean with a comfortable bed and a clean functional bathroom w/a shower. The neighborhood is teeming w/cafes, an outdoor market on Edgar Quinet, creperies, and a Monoprix (so don't stress if you forgot to pack shampoo or socks).

Reviews.Title: “A little gem, except for the stairs”
Reviews.Author: Zekes_mum
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Parc is a nice little place. Very convenient to lots of restaurants as well as Montparnasse train station, which was why we chose it to begin with. But the stairs at the front entrance stopped us from booking the place a second time. We were travelling with a toddler and the stuff that goes with that - stroller, car seat as well as the luggage. And having to haul it all up a large, circular flight of stairs was a pain in the rear end. There is a lift from the first floor where the reception is, but it doesn't go to the ground floor/street level. Otherwise the place was clean and pretty quiet and nicely decorated. The room was small, but then this is Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: nataaaaalie
Reviews.Content: Perfect for couples. Clean modern rooms. Great decor. Lovely area that's busy even in the evenings. Saff v friendly and willing to help. Great hotel for price. Definately would recamend.

Reviews.Title: “Good, fair priced hotel in Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: BDT37
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very accessible to transit, it was clean, the room (double) was good, and the breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Do it all, Eat it all, then Sleep without all that noise!”
Reviews.Author: Tooholli
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. We had almost all subway lines within walking distance of the hotel. An awesome creperie (Creperie Jocelyn) was two blocks away and offered an awesome menu (they open at 1130 and are closed on Mondays- get there right at opening to avoid the crowds). Lots of restaurants in the neighborhood of the hotel, plus a huge Monoprix for all of your needs (clothing, dvds, hygiene products, food, makeup, etc...you name it and it's there). Less than three blocks from Galeries Layfayette and tons of other shopping and cafes. The staff was truly accomodating, spoke english and provided a secure holding area for our bags after checkout so we could enjoy our last day in Paris before our 8pm flight. Very quaint hotel that was recently remodeled. Loved the clean lines of the furniture and fun wall coverings. Small room, but great storage possibilities. There is an elevator from the lobby to all of the upper floors, free wifi, and a guest computer in the lobby. Everyone in our group of 6 (three rooms) enjoyed the hotel and staff tremendously. Would absolutely stay there again, and we even got great rates over New Year's Eve. AWESOME.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DK09
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were very pleased with the Hotel and the friendly staff. The Rooms are small but clean with very comfy beds, the only negative was the noise from the street during the morning hours.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Adamella2
Reviews.Content: This place is central and quiet with friendly staff and nicely appointed rooms. Bring a google map of the area as rue Jolivet is a small street on not on some local maps.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocknroll123
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, great location close to Metro, cafes, restaurants, market. I had better experience here than at a larger well know hotel chain in Paris. I would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Parc is a great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: freewheelindave
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were impressed with our recent stay at Hotel du Parc Montparnasse.. The owners are friendly, going out of their way to assist with the storage of our bicycles, early check-in after 24 hours on the plane and arranging local transport. Thier rooms are well kept, modern and comfortably quiet. The nutritious and tasty breakfasts are popular and need to be taken early to avoid the rush. We will recommend the Hotel du Parc team to our friends in Australia because they have all been very welcoming, polite and willing to comprehend our Franglais.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet street yet so close to everything with excellent cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: geourbs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulously located within 5 minutes of Gare Montparnasse, tons of restaurants, the metro, a supermarket, a farmers' market and an art market. Yet it is on a quiet little street. The premises are super clean, very compact but comfortable. The staff are pleasant and helpful. The breakfast is excellent. The only difficulty I could see was the long haul up the first flight of stairs, luggage and all, with no elevator until the reception desk one floor above street level. If you are fit, the haul is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, more on the expensive side”
Reviews.Author: aaa18
Reviews.Content: Room size is decent for Paris standards. Some rooms seem to have a bathtub, others only have a shower. The neighborhood is good and close to Montparnasse and 2-3 metro stops. Generally clean and the staff is good, wifi works well. It seems to have been renovated recently with a nice design and good quality accessories. I found the price a bit expensive for the size though. Insulation (from above) is not great either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dodda54
Reviews.Content: the style is modern, the room small but comfortable, large bathroom with a small window, parquet floor, and not with the hideous carpet! the location is very convenient, nearby to subway, restaurants and bars of Montparnasse. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “they need to understand what customer relationship means.......”
Reviews.Author: phmcgpe
Reviews.Content: 2 EUR for a ticket train printing ....woo Hoo the screen shows 0.5 EUR and the front desk charge u without complexes..... 4 times the price - sounds like crook business isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quaint hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: timszel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accomodating. The staff were friendly, the room was nice and clean. The hotel is next to the Montparnasse cemetery where many famous people's tombes are. Metro stations are round the corner. There are many nice cafes in the area and if you wish to walk to the very centre, it will take you just about 30 minutes. Overall: very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Cute, Clean, Convienient!”
Reviews.Author: vacciani
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! It was bright and cheery and quite! The location was superb with a great little bistro across the street and MANY other places to dine around the corner! The subway stop was less than a block away. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. I have already recommended it to my family members and friends!

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern and pretty. Paris reasonable petit hotel”
Reviews.Author: gtmb
Reviews.Content: Very close from metro station and also from air port shuttle bus station. Many local restaurants around. You have to clime up stairs with your luggage to 2nd floor. This is the only one thing to note negatively.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not as good looking as the pictures would have you believe though”
Reviews.Author: K_OTown
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close enough to the metro station as many reviewers have stated (Montparnasse). The bicycle rental spot is also very close by. It's a very nice area with lots of restaurants. There's also a big grocery store nearby which sells very good bakery. The room itself was decent sized. The profile pictures they took would have you believe that it's a very modern upscale hotel -- it's not. There is a safe available in the room along with an LCD TV. The bathroom itself is a little outdated. The water temperature of the shower however was consistent. Note that from the main level up to the reception area there are no elevators. So you'll have to lug your luggage up two flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean little room”
Reviews.Author: kolukolu
Reviews.Content: Quite difficult to find if you are not familiar with the area. Once you know the way, take only 5-min walk to Paris Montparnasse. I stayed in a double room and I am fine with the size. Basic facilities are available which is good for value. Will definitely stay there again if I next visit Paris for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, & close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: iksnezok
Reviews.Content: We chose the du Parc based on price (75 euro/night) and convenient access to the Metro. The rooms are air-conditioned and the bathrooms large. The park is closed at night to keep the vagrants out.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: c4b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife. We got pretty good offer via internet from the hotel's web pages, so that and reviews here @ Tripadvisor got us there. Hotel staff was friendly, their english skills were OK. Only the weekend man had some trouble with it. Breakfast was ok, but it cost 12€ for one person! There might have been better ones and cheaper at one the many nearby restaurants or bars. Room was kinda small, but enough for us two. Lack of minibar was a bit disappointing (couldn't get champagne or wine cold!). Room was always kept clean, AC was a nice add to it too. Our room was in top floor, and it was really quiet thanks to the location of the hotel. It was also easy to go touring the city because of Montparnasse metro station. There was also a large grocery store nearby and Galerie Lafayette at Montparnasse shopping center if those are what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel Surrounded by Local Restaurants and Bars”
Reviews.Author: moonstar811
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. Room is small, but very clean. Close to many main subway lines. About 8 - 10 great restaurants, bars and cafes just outside the hotel. A wonderful place to stay if you want a real Parisian experience. Few tourists, lots of local people, good food and many places to people watch. If you go to Paris, it's worth it to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ecraighead
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our month long trip. Very convenient location: close to 3 different Metro lines, so you can get practically anywhere. I felt there could have been more tourist info available for visitors at the hotel. To access the front desk you have to go up 2 flights of stairs, but from there there is a tiny elevator up to the other 5 floors. Our room was a garret at the end of the building: very quiet, and loved waking up to the smell of croissants baking each morning. Had a big bathroom with bath and separate shower cubicle. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel - there were cheaper options around the area: lots of cafes and right in the heart of the theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, well-designed hotel for a fantastic value.”
Reviews.Author: JillBtraveler
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with my stay at Hotel du Parc. The rooms are very small with no views, as expected in a hotel that offers such a good value for a stay in Paris. However, it was absolutely perfect for my purposes (to sightsee and spend little time at the hotel). As my father, a veteran traveler said, it seemed as though it was designed from the ground up for a traveler. It has the much-coveted universal plug on each bedside table, hooks for bags, a comfy bed, big closets, a great shower in the attached bathroom, and was spotlessly clean. It's a bit far from the center of Paris, but again, a great value. The staff was courteous, helpful, and pleasant. They helped us get reservations at restaurants and were generally a source for information for us. The rooms were colorful, with a modern design, but eminently practical. And the free wifi was much appreciated. Thanks for our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to anyone looking for a good value hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: seyyah_2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to visit Paris without spending a fortune and we found this hotel through Tripadvisor reviews. Overall we had a very pleasant stay at Hotel du Parc. It is conveniently located in Montparnasse area, 1-2 min. walk to Edgar Quinet subway station and 3-4 min. walk to Montparnasse subway station (a very central one). Therefore we were able to visit key sites with very short metro rides (~15 min. to Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame). Overall the hotel is pleasant with clean and quiet rooms that come with very affordable prices in Paris standarts. Rooms are tiny as this is the Paris standart but are overall comfortable. The only downside is that the staff speak little English but they are overall friedly and helpful. I would stay again at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Small cozy hotel for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: Maxstudio
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my parents who are in their 60s. We stayed in a triple room on the fifth floor. The room is VERY small, but the beds are comfortable and we all slept well. The room is very clean and decorated beautifully. Would recommend for single travelers and couples on a budget. Won't recommend if you have kids with you. Staff are friendly. Location of this hotel is great. It is close to the train station and subway stations, as well as bakery shops and restaurants. It is not a fancy hotel but definitely a great value for travelers who are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, perfect for the budget traveler.”
Reviews.Author: gegoddard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 2 day layover in Paris. We paid a very fair price (79 Euro/ nt) for our room. It was very cozy (I don't think you would want to have more than 2 people in there), clean, and cute (in an Ikea kind of way). The hotel was a maybe a 3 minute walk to the Monparnasse train station/ bus stops (which put us within 10-15 minutes of just about any place we wanted to bein Paris). We bought the 2 day transportation passes so we jumped on and off buses and trains with no issues at all. We had a 6:30am train to catch to Germany and the gentleman at the front desk was very helpful with arranging for a taxi for us the night before (once we got passed the language barrier). I would highly recommend this hotel to any budget traveler looking for a good price on a good hotel with easy access to transportation. We also discovered it is just around the corner (in the direction away from the train station) from a bunch of bars and restaurants. I wouldn't recommend if you are unable to climb stairs. There is a full flight of (narrow) stairs to climb from the street to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in lively area”
Reviews.Author: Empar1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this nice little hotel near Montparnasse with a metro station (Edgar Quinet) just around the corner. Everything worked out nicely. The room was small but very clean and completely renovated. Our window was facing a nice square and there is free wifi. Although in a lively area, there was no noise at all in the room. The reception is on the second floor with no lift. However, there is a lift to access the rooms from the second floor. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: cc49cc
Reviews.Content: This was home for my grandson and I for three nights, and it could hardly have been better. The only downside to the room was the view out the window, which was rooftops. Would have been nice to have a balcony overlooking the park, but it really didn't matter much. The room had been recently remodeled and it suited us perfectly. Twin beds, a desk large enough for two, with two chairs and two outlets above the desk, and excellent wifi made for a perfect setup for a geeky granddad and geeky grandson. The shower was actually large enough to drop the soap and pick it back up without having to open the door, rare for a 2-star in Paris. And the A/C worked perfectly. Skip the hotel breakfast offering, go just around the corner to Au Plomb du Chantal (I think?) for a 6€ petit dejeuner. Very convenient Metro access, and a lovely walk to Notre Dame and Sainte Chapelle via le Jardin du Luxembourg. And all for 80€ a night in summer, by far the best value I've seen in Paris. I'd go back in a minute, just wish it was that inexpensive outside of July and August.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Geogios
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good value for money. It has cosy and clean rooms, but very small though. The breakfast was good but a bit expensive (was not included in the room price). The area around the hotel was very beautiful and quiet, full of bars, cafeterias and creperies. Very convenient was the proximity to metro stations, which helps a lot to descover the city easily.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great staff, great price!”
Reviews.Author: khw77
Reviews.Content: I had a really great stay here. The concierge/staff were so helpful in guiding me around Paris. My only slight complaint as a solo female traveler is I sort of felt that anyone could have walked in and said they were staying in my room and gotten my key. I could be wrong. I would stay there again though. Cute place and nice staff! Great price!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with all the necessities in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: sdyermeenenga
Reviews.Content: Don't bother with breakfast, there are lots of good cheap cafes a few steps from the hotel. Le Plomb de Cantal was cheapest - coffee, a croissant, a baguette with butter and jam and freshly sqeezed orange juice for 6 Euros per person. Lots of delicious creperies nearby. Also useful is a huge Monoprix supermarket on the corner of the road. 3 Metro stations very close to the hotel (Montparnasse Beinvenue, Edgar Quinet and Gaite). We took a travel kettle and tea and coffee, since there are no facilities for that in the rooms. The rooms are quite small but perfectly adequate and very clean, with TV, safe and air-conditioning. The bathrooms were fine. I would recommend the hotel to anyone and would certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: tazisa
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sfandmore
Reviews.Content: The bilingual staff was friendly & helpful, and the room was clean and plenty big for us. Rooms had wifi, air-conditioning, and a TV. The location was convenient for getting around Paris by Metro, 1 block from Edgar Quinet, and 2 blocks from the Montparnasse station. The area has a number of restaurants, shopping, and an outdoor market on many days.

Reviews.Title: “Great value holiday - would reccommend”
Reviews.Author: WrightFamilyFrance
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great value - rooms newly decorated and everything is clean. Location is great with shops, cafes and metro a minute away.... all other sites walking distance. Despite location hotel quiet as in back street overlooking a little park so still managed to sleep! We would def stay here agin as was great for exploring Paris. If we were to bring our 3 children next time we would need to check on rooms as the one we had wouldnt have fit all of us in. *Please note UK visitors - as is standard in French hotels there is no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Hotel does a breakfast and loads of cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: cairon2k
Reviews.Content: A modern Art Deco styled hotel, friendly staff, nice rooms and view. Value for money is great for young people.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, clean and friendly. Great location at affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: chloe-eloise
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Parc was lovely, great location and nice modern and clean rooms. The number 6 metro line is only 100m away and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the area. The Montparnasse Tower is very close where you can catch busses and outgoing trains. It also acts as a great landmark when viewing Paris from the Eiffel Tower or Montmartre The staff were friendly and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service for a two star rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMbaby
Reviews.Content: Travelling with a young infant. Staff were very friendly and were more than happy to help. Room was a triple (to cater for our baby) though the room was small. But good for when all you need to do in the room is sleep and change. No tea and coffee facilties which would have been nice...but great otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: PKazimir
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel which matched by requirements: close to Montparnasse which was practical for my business trip and good rating in Trip Advisor. The staff was friendly and the rooms very clean. Unfortunately, the shiny pink colour that is the mark of this hotel seems to attract a "romantic" type of customers. I almost could not sleep of the night, as the very thin walls conveyed every little noise from the rooms around. 3 different couples having fun at different hours of the night! Also, you would expect more from a breakfast at 12Euros than croissants and coffee... not matter how necessary the coffee can be after the night. I reserved for 2 nights, cancelled the second and found a cheaper and better place to sleep. Don't go there if what you are looking for is sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: George255100
Reviews.Content: The room was small with quite a nice bathroom. The room size was probably fair for the price as Paris is generally very expensive. The worst aspect was the view which was of a roof so no view really.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Sylviazinha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in the 14th arrondissement, just behing Pkace Edgar Quinet and close to Rue de la Gaité. I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel du Parc, where the rooms are clean and trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Great taste of design and warmth.”
Reviews.Author: rabbit65
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really great and the person in charge (the woman that I fogot her name) was very friendly and helpful and it seemed she took care of the small details to ensure she's meeting the standards. For us as a family of three members, I can say that the room was pretty small, so it's a wise idea to get larger spaces for families.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location + Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Lemiracle
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel du Parc in late May 2010. The location lives up to the billing: the hotel overlooks a quiet little park (our window opened on to it) so it's not loud, even though it sits just around the corner from the very lively square where Blvd. Edgar Quinet intersects three other streets. The hotel is located in the heart of the Montparnasse neighborhood -- the 14th arrondissement -- on the Left Bank (ie, slightly outside the center city). Not only are there lots of cafes, bars, restaurants and frequent street fairs just outside its door, you're also close to the Tour Montparnasse (which we did not visit) and the Cimeterie Montparnasse (which we did). The Jardin du Luxemborg and the Latin Quarter/Blvd. St. Germain are also within walking distance. The other major selling point when it comes to location is its access to public transit. You are just a block from the Edgar Quinet metro stop and only a five-minute walk to Gare Montparnasse (commuter rail) and the Montparnasse-Bienvenue metro station, which serves several subway lines. We had very easy rides to neighborhoods throughout Paris, including Roland Garros for a day at the French Open. As for the hotel itself: as others mentioned, you do have to walk up two flights of stairs to reach the lobby, which isn't easy with heavy luggage. An elevator from that 3rd-floor lobby serves the rest of the hotel, but it was out half the time we were there. Note: the rooms are pretty small. The double room we were in was a touch cramped for two people and luggage. That said, it was very clean and well kept and featured a fine shower, a small flat-screen TV and air-conditioning. The staff at the hotel was also very friendly. We ate breakfast one day on site, and it was good, though expensive (we preferred going out to the patiserries). There is also one free public internet-enabled computer in the lobby. We would definitely recommend Hotel du Parc. If you're going to spend a lot of time in the room, it may feel small. But you're not -- it's Paris, you're going to be out in the city -- and the great location carries the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pimentah2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! Clean, modern, the staff is very helpful, the breakfast is very good, i have no complaint. This hotel is very near to metro, train, cool restaurants, markets, galleries. I´ll surely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: krupina
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget hotel. Well-located. One computer for free internet use was nice. Room recently updated. Very small but to be expected in Paris. Bathroom quite large by comparison. Tub and separate small shower. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room in centre of lively location”
Reviews.Author: Brenda06
Reviews.Content: Room was very small, but newly decorated, clean & comfortable. Despite being situated in a busy, lively quartier, it was very quiet & restful. I would have no hesitation in using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: rosalie29
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful long weekend in Paris, staying at the Hotel du Parc. The hotel is very nice and charming. The recently renovated modern rooms are really small-sized, but fully equipped (TV, air-con, safe) and very clean, bathroom as well. Beds were also quite comfortable. As the hotel is opposite to a little park it is amazingly quiet for the central location, you can even hear the birds. Only during the night and if you like to sleep with your window open the noise from the bars and restaurants in the area can be annoying. Staff was very friendly and helpful with information. You also have a computer near the reception with free internet access for the guests. Breakfast for 12,- € per person was definitely too expensive for the quality and the choice offered. After the first breakfast in the hotel we decided to try the cafés just around the corner which was a good decision. Overall, we would absolutely recommend the hotel and would be happy to return for our next visit to Paris. The location is perfect as very central with two metro stations nearby and with a good choice of nice restaurants including numerous crêperies in an area which is also safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, in charming and accessible location.”
Reviews.Author: tarrago
Reviews.Content: Excellent in cleanness, location, staff attention, in spite of small size of the room and the 2 stairs to reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - BUT TWO flights of stairs”
Reviews.Author: dwitkin
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is a great value. Excellent location, close to much more expensive hotels but on a quiet street across from a small park. That said, you MUST be willing to walk two flights of stairs to get to the lobby. THERE IS NO ELEVATOR. Once you get to the main level, there is someone to greet you and a small elevator (typical for France) but this is not a hotel for people who will have difficultly with several flights of stairs each day. My wife and I had two weeks worth of luggage, so once we reached the main level someone from the hotel came down to help us, but it was a pain. Otherwise, very nice. Good bed. Decent sized room for the price (again, for France / Europe where very small rooms are the norm). Good sized bathroom. And free wifi internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, great location.”
Reviews.Author: fantax06
Reviews.Content: Got a few hiccups (staircase renovation, air-conditioning not working on first night, towels sometimes not replaced), but I take these as minor given the cheap price and great location for a stay at a newly renovated hotel. I just want to point out the toilet is not renovated though (not shown as one of the hotel photos), only repainted with the same facilities, but everything are very clean (cleaner than some 3-star hotels I've stayed). Reception service is ok (the usual service you expected in Paris?), but MUST leave keys behind everytime you leave hotel for housekeeping, find that a bit odd... The elevator is one of the most antique ones I have seen, maybe common in Paris buildings, finger-cross it doesn't stop working halfway through when we used it to carry us and our luggages, otherwise we always take the stairs. Internet only works in the lobby. GREAT STAY though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value...hope you enjoy hot pink, though!”
Reviews.Author: cbotterb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely adequate for couples who have reasonable expectations of Paris. The rooms are small but absolutely sufficient, the front desk is courteous and helpful. The wifi was spotty, but we could always leave our room and go to the breakfast room if we needed to connect. The majority of rooms have been newly renovated, which means they are decorated with hot pink curtains. Very clean and modern, but a little garrish after seven days. Hint: Rather than pay for their breakfast just do to the next door cafe and pay half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, much better then some 3-star and 4-star city hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Milos77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in fine neighborhood with lots of cafes and restaurants. Metro station nearby connects four metro lines so you can reach any part of the city easily. Hotel is nice and small, with very nice rooms and toilets. As I said in the title, much better then some 3-star and 4-star city hotels I have stayed in in some other cities. Free WiFi connection is available in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good location, friendly and helpful service, rooms average”
Reviews.Author: traveloooo
Reviews.Content: good location, friendly and helpful service, rooms average

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet stopover when using Gare Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Toulouse_Yankee
Reviews.Content: Despite unpromising signals from the tourist-trap train terminal area, the little Hotel du Parc has several advantages. If you have a late arrival or early departure from Gare Montparenasse and just want a place to sleep, the hotel is very nearby. It was absolutely quiet at night. The room was very clean though small, with spacious bathroom (ours had bath and shower). Comfortable bed. The staff were extremely nice. We did not have time for breakfast but it looked good though seemed a bit pricey at 12€ pp. The hotel is up one flight from street level and we did not see any elevator to the hotel reception but there was an elevator for the upper floors of the hotel. For better or for worse, the hotel is just a step from the Tour Montparnesse, shopping malls and cinemas abound. Some research should be done about restaurants before choosing; we went into the nearest pizza-Italian place and it was awful. We booked through ParisHotels.com (not to be confused with parishotels.com!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: LimeGreenCymbid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our stay with Hotel du Parc because of the Trip Advisor reviews. We were very with the accomodating staff, who allowed us to check in early (and check out late!) and who held our bags for a few hours while we did some last-minute sight seeing. The rooms were cozy but comfortable and were decorated tastefully. My husband found the shower to be slightly awkward (he is tall and found the shape/size to be a bit of a problem) but I thought that the modern bathroom was perfect for our needs. The location near the Montparnasse travel hub made it extremely easy to get anywhere in the city within minutes. I would absolutely stay there again. Tip: Although choosing the breakfast option would be somewhat convenient, at 12 Euros per person, we found it slightly expensive for the quality and quantity of breakfast menu options. There are plenty of spots nearby for great breakfast food at less than half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with good surroundings”
Reviews.Author: zkx1325
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Du Parc together with my parents for a total of 5 nights. Here are the good points: - The owners were very flexible in their bookings. I had to cancel one night, the booking system made me forfeit the booking fee of that night, but the owners were willing to transfer that fee to pay for one of the other 5 nights. - The staff were very helpful, always willing to answer questions. - Very good surroundings. With many cafes and restaurants, offering a wide range of cuisine. You'll never starve there. - Updated looks for the rooms. Generally clean and cosy. Good TV programme offerings. - Very close to 3 Metro Stations. This means that you can choose which station to go to as there are many lines in the Paris Metro system. - Breakfast is basically tasty. Not too bad. - Small minimart right opposite the hotel. (Closes at night). - Quiet at night, as it's not facing the cafes and restaurants. - FREE WIFI. Bad points: - There's a long flight of stairs before you get to the reception & lift. Warning for those carrying heavy luggages, and for the elderly who hate stairs. - The lift to your rooms starts at the reception. The lift is SMALL, and dont forget the long flight of stairs even before you get to the lift. - I saw a mouse along the corridor when I was going to my room for the first time. It ran away and I never saw it again during my stay. - The rooms is rather cramped for three people staying in a double room. - There isn't a kettle in the room. No hot drinking water available at night. This means no hot coffee or hot tea at night. :( - FREE WIFI. As it's free, and it's not password protected, it's unstable and may disconnect at times. Overall, my parents weren't too impressed cos of the long flight of stairs BEFORE you get to the lift and reception. (They're older and we travelled with large suitcases.) The rooms were a bit too small for their liking. But the surroundings, convenience to the metro stations and the hotel service made up for the disadvantages. I'll recommend Du Parc if you travel light, and don't mind stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, noisy neighbours”
Reviews.Author: F24
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel when it comes to: room, bath, design, welcome. Not as good: reception on first floor without elevator to reach it. Bad: very noisy neighbours next room, drinking beer in the corridor at 2 am, without anybody from the management to cool them down.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: KanadianCaker
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a modern feel to it and was very clean. The room however was very small for 102 euros per night. One suitcase had to be on the desk and the other vertical in order to walk around the double bed. For a side street, Rue Jolivet was quite noisy even in the middle of the night due to all the cafes and restaurants in the area. The nightly garbage truck made for a lot of noise while trying to sleep. All late night and early morning noise aside, the neighbourhood in Montparnasse was great and had a really good meal literally a minute away from Hotel du Parc. The hotel itself was nice, but for the cost, room size and exterior noise factures I would stay somewhere else in Montparnasse the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and the accommodations were very nice”
Reviews.Author: maggidan
Reviews.Content: The staff and the accommodations were very nice, I have no complaints. The rom was small but perfectly OK, and the bathroom was very good. The free internet connection was an added plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: momflys
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Paris with my two grown children and we stayed for two nights at the Hotel du Parc. The hotel is in a great location a very small park along with a grocery store (ED) and Monoprix store directly across the street . There are numerous restaurants all over the area in various price ranges and the Edgar Quinot metro stop is just around the corner. Montparnesse is just a block over from the hotel. The hotel itself is quite nice for the price. The owners have redone the interior and everything is brightly painted and in a modern decor. The hotel itself is located up two flights of stairs but there is an elevator once you reach the hotel itself. We paid 135 euros through Booking.com(without breakfast) for a triple room with 3 single type beds and it was perfect. The bathroom is small but has a tub with shower arrangement although they need to put in a shower curtain. There was a flat screen TV,free Wifi,safe and hairdryer along with a towel warmer which was nice.Beds were comfortable and area was quiet at night.There was a cute breakfast area that looked like it had a nice selection but we wanted to do breakfast on the run.(The area behind the metro stop has over 10 creperies that were quite tasty for a lunch or breakfast). The owners were helpful with maps and making dinner reservations for us which was helpful. I have been to Paris numerous times because of my job but had never stayed over in this area. I really liked the hotel and the area. The only negative for my family was that the metro line from the Edgar Quinot line required us to change alot to where we wanted to go but I imagine if you walked over to the Montparnesse station you would find better metro lines for travel around Paris. Would highly recommend staying here especially if you need a triple room for a family!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, it's the right choice”
Reviews.Author: spuercazzola
Reviews.Content: A small hotel, sufficiently clean, in the centre of the city. Restaurants and "night life" is really near without bothering your sleep. metro is near, Trains are near, prices are good. And FREE WIFI! I think it's a good choice if you want to visit Paris for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to train, metro, and bus station. Near many restuarants and cafe's”
Reviews.Author: mellymac10
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel we were worried to see some construction going on. We thought " this is going to be a nightmare". We quickly realized that the construction wasn't going to be a problem at all. Our room was very neat and clean. The bathroom was large and updated, which was a great surprise. The location was fantastic. We were worried about choosing a hotel further away from the center of Paris, but it wasn't a problem. There is a huge metro/train station right down the block. There are also multiple smaller metro stations around the area. The woman at the front desk was friendly and very helpful. We asked her for directions to some sightseeing locations multiple times. Each time she gave us accurate directions, with a smile. The male front desk staff memebers were not as friendly. We had a great stay! We will stay at hotel du parc again, and recommend it to friends. Great for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfortable hotel, in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Ricki_L
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel in good location - convenient for the Metro. Reasonably priced. Although wifi was available I had trouble getting it to work.

Reviews.Title: “What a location! :)”
Reviews.Author: turist061
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing negative I can say about Hotel du parc. The location is so fantastic. A few steps from several metro stations, hundreds of restaurants nearby, even a gallerie lafayette! The staff was very helpful, spoke good english and answered every question we had. The rooms are small, but equipped with everything you need. I would say that you get A LOT for a small price (being in Paris and everything). Would not reccomend breakfast at the hotel if you like more then just a dry baguette and some jam. You can get whole breakfast menues (with desserts!) in many of the nearby restaurants and cafees :) By the way, the food everywhere we ate was FANTASTIC! Am most probably staying there next time i'm in Paris. The location is really the best.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, close to the center”
Reviews.Author: liudache
Reviews.Content: the only thing which I didn't like - too small room. we were on our way to mountains with snowboard bags - there was no place to walk around the bed...

Reviews.Title: “Good - Simple hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: LavanderiaChina
Reviews.Content: Let's make it short: Pros: -Excellent Location in Monpartnasse - Affordable price -Good bathroom Cons: -Small , cram room. But hey this is Paris, what else would you expect here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central, no frills”
Reviews.Author: secaBoulder
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very conveniently located near Montparnasse station and Edgar Quinet. The district has lots to do but the hotel itself is quiet. Stayed with a group and saw several rooms -- rooms are small as should be expected in Paris, but clean, and the beds are comfortable queens. Baths, tho tiny, are well tended with excellent hot water and plenty of towels. Good heat in a very cold December. Free wireless internet is available, handy and helps with the value of the room but I had to continually restart the connection -- perhaps there is a limit to the number of connections at any time. Front desk service is reasonable but not particularly friendly. There is no lift from the front door but upper floors have lift. The initial staircase is shabby, but the rooms are in better shape and the web photos are accurate. Good traveler budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Booking cancelled (overbooking) and terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: vegastar330
Reviews.Content: First of all, our review is based on the sole fact our booking for 2 nights was cancelled by the hotel without prior notice, so we arrived there on a freezing December night at 23H00 only to discover our booking had "disappeared". But the most crazy thing was the customer service: the person at the reception told us after looking for really 5-7 minutes we had never booked the hotel (even though we showed him a copy of the confirmation from Expedia)! and asked us twice if we hadn't "made a mistake" while booking online!! As the hotel was full, we quickly understood when the person started reading the newspaper again we had to go and search out for another hotel... My guess is that the management of this hotel will squeeze out people who booked with a special fare if they manage to fill the rooms at higher rates. Avoid this hotel, Paris is full with hotels who treat better their customers!

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: coarraze64
Reviews.Content: We just regret no effort was made for the bread at breakfast time. The hotel deserves refined high quality traditional yeast bread.... That very good traditional crusty bread was served in little nearby restaurants. So it shouldn't be too difficult to find. All the very best. I have often recommended the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel - A few stops away from all major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Lee_Bex
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend for Xmas Day (3days in total ) - From getting off the plane catch a airfrance coach outside the airport to Montparrnasse Station the its literally a few minutes walk to the hotel ( Just before the big tower) There a several metro stops around the hotel - it all depends which way you decide to walk - the closest is less than a minute ( edgare quinet ) Brillant Xmas - all round esp the 3 course meal at the eiffel tower followed by a cruise down the siene then to Moulin Rouge - for champagne and a show. ( £150 each for all three things- not bad for Xmas Day ) Hotel is nice - I liked that it is off the main street but walk up to the top of the road and there is restuarant after restuarant - we went to a grill place one night - t-bone steak amazing - then on Xmas Eve to an Indian called Himilayas - Not the best and very expensive for what it was. Overall Paris was Brill !!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly & Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: HelloPossums
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. We arrived very early in the morning and the staff were very helpful in arranging for us to get at least 1 room early. We walked around the area and visited a market just around the corner and sampled some great local produce. The Eiffel tower is a easy 30 min walk and also the Louvre and Notre Dame about the same. The breakfast was very nice to get you started for the day. Would recommend for your stay in Paris. Also the free Wi-Fi was very handy!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel met all of my requirements & is excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: COVAGEN
Reviews.Content: A great location for a tourist; transport could not be easier.At the same time a very private hotel & a quiet place to work.The staff are friendly & very efficient.The hotel has everything a visitor needs at avery affordable price for Paris.You get what you see on their website with no surprises ,this can be unusual for a capital city. Of course the room is not huge but the website tells you the dimensions; it is above average for Paris & more than adequate I have stayed in many hotels in Paris of all sizes & star classifications. For me ,this is the best value for money. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location near Montparnasse Station”
Reviews.Author: MarkMcGranaghan
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, excellent service, rooms very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, cheap hotel. Value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: deppy_89
Reviews.Content: Renewed ,small rooms in an old hotel... At the reception some were gentle some were rude. Very clean... I would stay again....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SunGreece
Reviews.Content: Modern, nice hotel in the center, near to the underground station. The rooms were recently renovated, comfortable, clean, quiet, and well equipped, with big bathroom. The hotel is located close to 4 metro lines - makes travelling around very easy! We would stay again. Free Wifi on the room. Professional and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - next to the Tube, restaurants and bars.”
Reviews.Author: Rye5099990
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and modern - but fairly small. Cleaning staff are polite. Front of house staff are helpful. 24 hour - so you can return when you please. Cafe for breakfast was pleasant - overlooking a nice little square. 150 yards from Montparnesse Benvenue tube station and 50 yards from Edgar Quinet tube station so transport links are excellent - no more than 10 mins to any of the major attractions. All in all a pretty good stay - and not too bad at all for the price. You could do a lot worse in the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Peregrintor
Reviews.Content: Room with 2 beds was a bit small but the bathroom was spacious. Good information at the front desk, and the continental breakfast was excellent. One of the best budget hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Fr0ggi3
Reviews.Content: Having a little hard time locating the Hotel at first at it is not on the main road, couldn't find it in a map! Circling around the area asking around and it is actually just there! Funny! Should had been easier if I know French or able to pronouce the street name right. But people around are really helpful, one actually called the hotel on his cell for me, and another actually took out her map catalog to look for the small street. Amazing :) Location was great, lotsa shops, convenient stores and F&B's around, and a metro station just 1 minute walk! Lovely. Free Wifi, lovely rose theme room, corridors with sensors for the lightings, I think its just great. Yeah, a morning flee market too but cant remember what day it was. Only thing that might upset some people is the staircase up to the reception...I was carrying total of 40 kilos on me up the stairs, and walking around asking people where's the hotel. But once u get there, its just great. Me and my gurl friend loved it so much. I'm not too sure if trips involving many family members tho. For young couples or friends, definately should be here :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and well-located - Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: klws524
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights but on separate days. The location is great - very near to Gare Montparnasse Train station and metro. The staff are very friendly and allow us to check-in early on the day of arrival and late check-out (when we are expecting a long haul back Hong Kong). Love the cosy and modern atmosphere in the room. Also it is clean and decent, probably since it is newly renovated. We stayed in 1st Floor and 5th Floor respectively. The noise level was minimal on top floor and we were glad there was lift so that we dont have to climb up stairs. Lots of cafes, restuarants and night pubs nearby which can also enable us to go for drinking late at nights. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BookwormOxford
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is so close to the Gare du Montparnasse (about 5 minutes' walk). In spite of its convenient location, it is very quiet. It was not cheap - 120 euros a night for a double room - though I discovered that, if we had booked direct with the hotel rather than through the agency, it would have been cheaper. But it was worth the money and we will use it again. The bedroom and bathroom were well equipped and clean, though quite small like most Paris hotels. The breakfast was good value. The staff were, without exception, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: iiuub
Reviews.Content: We were quite happy with Hotel du Parc, staying there 3 nights. The room was nice and the bathroom had a good shower. Very quiet, even when the hotel was fully booked. There are metro stops near, though we prefered walking and using the Velib bikes. A really nice market nearby at least on Saturday mornings, and a shop just opposite. The breakfast was ok, but it's also worthwhile to check what the nearby restaurants and cafes have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect one-night hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobeThrottler
Reviews.Content: Very quietly located close to Gare Montparnasse. Clean and nice room. The (free) wireless worked very well on 5th floor, despite the staff saying it would not. Only problem I had was the the lift was out of order. I stayed just for a short night, spending the evening working on my room via the wireless and leaving the hotel before breakfast. For my purpose, the hotel was very good. A nice Aristocats-style view over archetypical Paris roofs with multiple pipes from each chimney compensated for the climb to the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Gem in the Montparnasse Area”
Reviews.Author: LaLaMischa
Reviews.Content: We are a thirty-something couple who visited Paris for the sights and scenery. This hotel is ideal if you are looking for a comfortable, affordable, clean, sanctuary that is only 2-3 blocks from the train/metro station. Generally areas around train stations make me pause, but don't let that deter you from considering this property. It was in no way sketchy or undesirable. All major metro lines intersected into the station next to this hotel which made sightseeing a very easy endeavor. Across the street is a Monoprix grocery store in case you need food, wine, snacks or incidentals. Within a block are a variety of brasseries and cafes. The room, although small by US standards, was clean and quiet. We opted not to take breakfast in morning, but it is offered for a surcharge and consists of juice, coffee, bread and jam. You will have to go elsewhere if you are looking for something more substantial. The proprietors are a husband/wife team who are extremely helpful, courteous and knowledgeable of all things Paris. I would not recommend this property if you are on a business trip because the amenities are simple. We stayed for five nights and were grateful we did. If you want to be pampered in luxury and amenities go spend five times more and mark this property off of your list. If, however, you are looking for a pleasant hotel in close proximity to the metro, a two story grocery store, numerous locations to eat, with a helpful staff, and very affordable, you would be foolish not to consider the Hotel du Parc. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient, clean, pretty room, close to a terminal station”
Reviews.Author: Dragon31
Reviews.Content: The room was new and fashonable and VERY clean. Especially the bathroom was very confortable with good amenities. Bit small that there are not enough space to open a big luggages. However, totally very cozy hotel to stay in. The location, it located very close from the terminal station, which was indeed convinient. But bit difficult to find it, so better print out a detailed map to reach from the station. The breakfast was simple French style but taste nice. Lift there are no lifts go up for the 1st flour, where the reception is located. You have to crime up stairs. But from 1st flour to other rooms there are a lift. I would choose this hotel to stay if I go to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to our friends.”
Reviews.Author: aMei
Reviews.Content: Our room looked exactly like the pictures they showed on the website. The room was pretty small, but I think that is normal for Paris. The room was clean and pretty quiet. The 24 hour reception was really helpful for us since our flight arrived at 11:30pm, so we checked in around 1am. The hotel is about a 1-2 minute walk from 2 different metro stations that we were aware of. We were pleasantly surprised to find an open-air-farmers' market type thing right next to the hotel on Saturday (foods & goods) & Sunday (art) mornings. On our first morning of exploring Paris, one of the hotel receptionists actually walked with us for a bit, then guided us towards Luxemburg garden. The map we had wasn't detailed enough. She also recommended an excellent crepe restaurant near the hotel: Creperie Josselin. The best crepes I've ever had. She was also the most fluent in English. All the receptionists spoke enough English to be helpful. The reception area is one floor up with only stairs. Once you're in the reception area there is an elevator that takes you to the rest of the floors. We didn't mind the stairs and only used the elevator on the day we checked in. (We lived 2 floors up from the reception area.) They provide breakfast for an extra fee (6euros I think, we never ate there). I did see it and it looked pretty good (lots of breads). Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price.”
Reviews.Author: moheat1
Reviews.Content: This being my first trip to Paris and all it may be an unfair review, I really have no comparison to other accommodations in the city. All I can really say is that the room was clean, very small but clean, the bathroom could have used some work, but it was livable and for the most part very clean. Coming from Canada I think I'm used to a hell of a lot more in a hotel room, but in Paris that is just not the case. For example, don't expect a kettle or coffee maker to make tea, or an iron, or toiletries of any kind. However, like I said, if you're prepared you don't really need those things, they are just a bonus. The only complaint I have is after an international flight, arriving early (6am), I wasn't able to check in until the usual time of 2pm, so I had been up for over 24 hours.
