I had made a note in the reservation and it would have been nice to check in early, but I understand that they need time to change things over. The staff were very pleasant and very helpful, someone is always up front to greet you, 24 hours a day. Location was great, right near 2 metro stations and several cafes. A Starbucks was also very close at hand which was comforting. There is also a Monopix right next door, which is a grocery store, you can find anything you need there, anything.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean, newly renovated, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Menifeemonkey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (we're in our 50-60's) stayed there 3 nights. Typically very small Parisian 2-3 star room, but nicely updated/renovated. Bathroom and bedroom were very clean (and we're very picky about that!) and towels replenished, bed freshly re-made with clean linens every day. Staff very pleasant and helpful and front-desk personnel spoke excellent English (but also indulged and persevered valiantly when we tried to converse in our limited French). Breakfast room (continental breakfast only) seemed popular, but for a hot breakfast we found better value at the local cafes/brasseries which are scattered all around the hotel. All in all, great value for Paris. Two caveats: 1. Be prepared to lug your suitcases up two flights of stairs to reach reception (elevator doesn't run to ground floor). 2. Don't be put off by the facade, which is dreadfully ininviting.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: esmith123
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very quiet but also close to metro, shops, and many places to eat. The room was on the small side, as I have heard is typical of Paris hotels, but it met the needs of my husband and me. The staff spoke English. The room and bathroom were both very clean. The bed was sort of hard, that was our lone complaint about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccomended”
Reviews.Author: Mpt2009
Reviews.Content: You can not expect more from a two stars hotel. The room is very clean and aircondintioned. Reasonable continenetal breakfast. The most important things: Excellent staff and great location, just a short walk to the Metro, resturants and shopping center. Highly reccomended !

Reviews.Title: “Every Time Again”
Reviews.Author: au00033
Reviews.Content: The hotel has small but modern new adapted room's. Excelent for short city trip. The next time we stay in Paris we will choose the hotel again. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cost reflects excellent position, but hotel is clean and friendly with non smoking rooms and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: bagpiper000
Reviews.Content: Although the room we stayed in was a bit cramped, it was modern, very clean and well equipped. The bathroom, unlike many in Paris, was big and comfortable. The hotel's location opposite a small park is very peaceful, while still being within a short walking distance from the main train station and numerous eating places. Perfect also for non-smokers. The only real down side was the staircase to the lobby on the first floor, as you had to carry bags up before being able to use the lift. We would stay again if the price fitted our budget.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location for bars and restaurants, very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: LondonRosalind
Reviews.Content: staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel had plenty of bars and restaurants close by and was only a short distance from the metro. Our room was clean and we would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for good value for money in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in this hotel for my trip to Paris. Found this hotel based on reviews from Tripadvisor and was definitely a good choice. Good value for Paris. Small and hidden hotel and there were no big signs outside the hotel so a bit hard to find. Once go in there is a big staircase one has to climb with all luggage to get to the lobby. Staff know only basic English and the lift was old. However rooms are clean and comfortable. There were free wifi offered though signal a bit weak (I was on 4th floor) and there were advertising every 30 mins or so. Overall an excellent value for hotels in Paris and would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, romantic, well-located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EmmabelleMtl
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with how this booking turned out. I came from outside Europe and wanted a room that would be clean, private, comfortable and had a good feel to it. The room at Hotel du Parc was exactly like the website photos! It was fresh and modern, quiet, romantic and spotless. Don't be afraid of everybody talking about "small Paris hotel rooms"... there was enough space to be perfectly comfortable. The metro is VERY close, as is the airport shuttle station. There are lots of little cafes to explore in the neighbourhood, or hop on the metro and you're in a different neighbourhood in minutes. Wifi internet worked great in the room. The one-storey walk-up to the lobby is really nothing to worry about. If you've already managed to drag your luggage through the city, you'll get up a few steps, no big deal! Overall, I'm so happy with how this worked out. My tip? Book early and see if you can get a discount off the regular prices!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,clean and good looking”
Reviews.Author: nemoSicily
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not very big but absolutely good looking (has been refurbished),comfortable and clean.There 2 metro station very close to the hotel:Edgar Quinet and Montparnasse Bienvenue.Many restaurants and cafè in that area.Saint Germain area is just 15 minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All round good stay!”
Reviews.Author: ForeverWanderer
Reviews.Content: Practical location with good transport links- nearby metro, Gare Montparnasse and Airport bus links. Well mantained rooms, spotlessly clean, secure and quiet at an excellent price. I would chose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worth every cent (and that wasnt much!)”
Reviews.Author: conorzinhoo
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect. Near the metro and if you fancied walking only 30 min walk to the center. Very nice inexpensive resteraunts just around the corner. Supermarket next door that sold everything, very handy for water and rolls when you are heading to the center for the day. Hotel was very clean and the staff helpful and friendly. Spent 4 nights there and will definitly return. :)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dina5000
Reviews.Content: I found that tripadvisor recommended this place, and since using the Paris metro to get around isn't hard, I went for it. We stayed in Rm 9, which was the two twin bed room. Although the room wasn't large, it was perfect for what we brought (two pieces of luggage and two backpacks). The bathroom was a decent size too. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel is also located near some restaurants if you don't want to venture too far away, and just down the street is the entrance to a metro. The hotel doesn't have parking, but the tower next to it, has parking where you can park for the weekend for 35 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodation, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: c0m0d0
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice decorated and clean even if a single room was very small. Service was very friendly and helpful, but I expected a bit more friendly service serving my breakfast. Anyway, I enjoyed my stay in this hotel and would recommend it everytime to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: hmillard
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic and the staff very friendly and helpful. Would advise using 'Edgar Quinet' Metro station rather than 'Montparnasse Bienvenue' as it's a lot quicker to get out of once you step off the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - would happily stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ScottMordrick
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for a weekend with my girlfriend, found this hotel after looking for several hours online. They had a decent summer deal which made it quite cheap and the rooms looked quite nice. The rooms have recently been redecorated and have a modern style to them. They are not the biggest but do everythig they ask. The hotel is located in the southern area of Paris, the nearest metro stations being montparnasse or edgar quinet. have to say did struggle to find the hotel at first. The area where the hotel is located is actually really nice and we spent our first evening out in the area. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were really clean and well maintained. Overall i would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends, especially those looking for slightly cheaper accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, convenient boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bird78
Reviews.Content: Positives - Friendly, helpful service - Clean rooms - Modern design - Located close to several main metro stops Negatives - Had to use the iron in the lobby - very strange - Bathroom, while very clean, is a little tired

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Bug39
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay in this hotel with our two teenagers and 10 year old. Although the rooms were small (as all are in Paris), we were very pleased with what our rooms had to offer. The beds and pillows were exceptionally comfortable, the rooms were quite clean and looked newly remodeled, and the bathrooms roomy and practical. Just across the street was a park and a Monoprix (grocery and miscellaneous) store where we could grab a quick breakfast or snack. The area was charming and filled with hopping cafe's and restaurants. The location was off the beaten path of all the museums and the river, but there was easy access to the Metro and the Air France Bus shuttle (to and from the airport). We even walked to Notre Dame one day just to see a little bit more of life in Paris (about 45 minutes). The only thing we would do differently is to ask for a street side room to view the park. The staff was not super fluent in English, but we got by. We did love our rooms. You will not be disappointed staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bjbToronto
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel du Parc. The location is perfect for enjoying the many attractions that are within walking distance (e.g. Jardin Luxembourg). It is very convenient for the Metro, and Gare Montparnasse. The Tour Montparnasse was always a visible landmark when we were walking , and helped us not to get lost! The room is tiny but very clean, with modern decor, windows and a modern bathroom. The air conditioning unit worked perfectly and was appreciated. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ample and always served promptly in the attractive breakfast area overlooking the little park. The front lobby and entrance stairs carpeting need improvement, as they do not make a good first impression, but that is a minor complaint. The short streetscape is somewhat depressed, with a few homeless souls using the park overnight. We would return again and be happy to recomment this hotel to anyone looking for an economical yet pleasant stay in Paris. The Barons, Toronot, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “The room and location were great”
Reviews.Author: Criyss
Reviews.Content: The room was very cleanbig bathroom, the location is great, near montparnasse tour; quiet area

Reviews.Title: “A superb location, great service, the room was small and a bit expencive”
Reviews.Author: Chunga-Changa
Reviews.Content: Pro's: The hotel is located in the very centre of Montparnasse area, surrounded by endless restaurants (great sushi places). Very close to the train station (about 3-5 minute walk). There is a supermarket close by (2 minute walk). At the same time the windows of our room were facing little park, so the noise from the crowded restaurant street didn't reach us. The room is clean and, I think, just recently have been renovated. The staff was very frendly and helpful. Con's: The room is very small for the price you pay. There is no cattle in the room to make tea/coffie. Overall: We would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Scott-Jo
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly staff. Modern refurbished rooms. Very clean. Sadly we were woken by carpet fitters hammering on the stairs at 7:00am one day, but apart from that our stay went uninterrupted. Noise and lack of sleep was our only issue (mainly due to a noisy American family next door!) In good location, near restaurants and bars, short walk from the Jardin du Luxembourg. Good sized rooms for a Paris hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: SarahBoyes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated very centrally with good metro acess. The room was very small but lovely. Everything was newly fitted and modern. The price was very reasonable and I will defenitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, good hospitality and nice room!”
Reviews.Author: snowwind77
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied as it's very convenient just 3 min on foot from Monparnas bus stop and the room was good size and nice decoration. Also receptionist was very kind and friendly! We asked her to book a restaurant for us and check the time of boat trip, she was willing to do it. Only a pity was that a maid opened a door to set a bedcover while we were there but it's still acceptable. We will use this hotel again definitely as it's good value for price!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mlil85
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on trip advisor as I usually do and this is the first time I feel like tripadvisor failed me. I have been to paris a few times but this hotel has been the worst value of any of the places i have stayed by far. I booked it to be close to the metro and to be near the latin quarter. The location was good being near the city center but it was by no means great. It was hard to find and around the corner from sex shops which I think is pretty common in paris. It was a decent metro ride to the main sites. We arrived early in the morning from an overnight flight and the reception made no effort to check us in early so we had to wait until 3pm and even at that point the room was still being cleaned. We wanted to shower but the hot water had been turned off and the reception told us to wait until they were finished doing whatever was so important. The beds were about as soft as worn airline seats and the our room was very small. With so many hotels in Paris I reccommend going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “better than what you might think when looking at it from outside”
Reviews.Author: leffi333
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is situated just a few footsteps from Blvd Edgar Quintet with its lively market on most days and Rue de La Gaitê with theatres, cafés and restaurants. Still it's fairly quiet in the neigborhood during the night. Maintenance and upgrading in the stairways was ongoing while we were staying there, but that wasn't really a problem. The rooms (we had two) and bathrooms were clean and tidy. The beds were ok, and the showers worked perfectly. There was no minibar in the room, but a coin machine in the reception. The breakfast was a bit ordinary, boring and typically french, with baguette, croissant and jam, so we ended up buying stuff at the local Monoprix some days, just for a change (stayed 9 nights). Transport-wise we found the location close to several undergrounds/train and bus stations very convenient (airport bus to/from Montparnasse to CDG/Orly, metro there and on Edgar Quintet and Gaite near by) . Managed to connect to several free wifi WLAN connections, which is convenient if you have a laptop/phone with you. There also was a pc available in the reception/breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value compared to other surrounding hotels”
Reviews.Author: kimbopumpkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel after booking online for 90 euros/night. It turned out to be good value for money compared to what other surrounding hotels were offering. To give a bit of an idea - a rather average/bit shabby hotel were offering rooms at 85 euros, with the Holiday Inn quoting 150 euros and another 4 star hotel starting from 165 euros... Here is what I found at the Hotel du Parc: - Hotel front is quite small so can be easily missed. Otherwise location is quite good - very close to the metro & surrounding shops and markets - Whilst there is a lift to the room, be prepared for a few steps up to the reception area. - Room was clean & bright with tasteful decor. - Service was good - guy at reception speaks good english and was happy to help with my limited french. - Reasonably quiet even - managed to sleep ok even without my usual earplugs - Free wifi internet which seems to cut out every 30min-1hr or so but can be easily reconnected. Whilst bearing in mind that Paris is an expensive place to live, this hotel was reasonable in what it offered, and so based on this I would consider recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “great location, quiet, clean”
Reviews.Author: crodfra
Reviews.Content: We had a very quiet room, clean place, big bathroom with bath and shower. They are currently renovating the hotel (April '09), so don't forget to ask for a "renovated" room. Very good location at Montparnasse, next to the "creperies", bars, theatres, shopping and 4 lines of metro can bring you easily to other neighborhoods of Paris. There is an elevator but starting from the 1st floor only where the reception is. Don't be surprised! We cannot say for the breakfast, we prefered taking it outside. It was the first time i was booking on internet an hotel room and i was anxious because i know in Paris, you can have very bad surprises sometimes. But there, it was a very good surprise for the price we paid! (average of 90E per night)

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: OneWorldHotel
Reviews.Content: Got ourself the newly refurbished room which was great. Location was great - just minutes away from metro station and plenty of restaurants espcially Chinese restaurant around the hotel. Reception was helpful to get us a room as we arrived early than the usual check in time. Another wonderful facility was the free wifi facility in the room. The only downside was we have cart our luggage up to the reception which is on the 1st floor of the hotel. So just take note of that. Overall, will recommend this hotel to traveller on a budget. Try to book on the internet as the rates will be much lower.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money in a hugely overpriced city”
Reviews.Author: ChrisL1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Du Parc first weekend in may and would have no hesitation about going back. The room cost 180 Euros for 2 nights including breakfast which was significantly cheaper than some of the other hotels. Its a 2 star but dont let that put you off at all. The room itself was very small with a basic bathroom attached however, the rooms were very clean, modernly decorated and had a tv with english channels (something for me to watch whilst my partner was doing her hair) The breakfast was a basic continental - croissant and baguette with jam. Sufficient for me. The area the hotel is on is quite lively and you felt safe walking around at night. it's also a 1 minute walk from the Edgar Quinet station making access to the other parts of Paris very easy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a bed to sleep in whilst exploring Paris. If you are looking for a hotel to spend long periods of time in, this is not for you. Will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: SteZenov
Reviews.Content: I travel alone shooting photos all day and night, rooms was little but the perfect size for me and very good looking, very smart in furniture disposal, 5th floor, no noise at all, all things working well. No problem, only fun and relax. Breakfast, good but not what a german would expect :) But I've seen worse for 2 times the price!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: KMSChennai
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this Hotel with my friend. It is conveniently located, close to one of the main rail stations of Paris. There are a wonderful variety of eating places close to the hotel and one cam get to many interesting tourist sites by walk. Rest of Paris well connected by metro rail. The Hotel is moderatley priced, the service is friendly and good. The rooms, though smallish, are modern, ensuited and comfortable. Overall a very good experience, staying in this hotel and visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time and will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: lannleroy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a side street, which makes it quiet. We didn't hear any traffic noise from the nearby train station. Staff is great and the rooms are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, quit situated but central to visit everything.”
Reviews.Author: krook
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, we were in paris to run the marathon, the hotel is situated on a quiet square, so you can sleep without noise, and is situated nearby the metro, gare and fine restaurants. Breakfast was good, and the rooms were clean and all the equipment in the shower was working correctly.Montparnasse is a fine place to stay, when we will visit paris in the future we will definitely book this hotel again André and yvonne Voets from holland

Reviews.Title: “Undiscovered gem, convenient location, non-touristy location!”
Reviews.Author: spartancarl
Reviews.Content: The only downside to this place is it is hard to find when you first arrive. Just take the train to Monparnasse St, and find a cab with a GPS. Its worth the 3 euro ride to just locate the street. Friendly staff, excellent room cleaning service, beautiful off-the-main-beaten-tracks neighborhood with many nice cafes, creperies, and restaurants, very close to the monparnasse train stop, easy to find your way home on a walk (orient with the huge skyscraper), great price, and newly renovated!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice shopping and restaurant interlude hotel before travelling ..”
Reviews.Author: NAMLILLE
Reviews.Content: close to 5 minutes walking from Gare Montparnasse or from taxis if you need like me to take an eraly plane to the Orly airport. You can go shopping to the innostore very close to the hotel and even to Galerie Lafayettes or rue de Rennes. If you need to go to the theaters or to a japaneese restaurant, hotel du Parc is located very close to Rue de la gaite. Very good area and good quality price ratio for the room. The only suprise I had to to go upstairs to find the entrance receiption.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, HARD to find”
Reviews.Author: gloryb23
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very nice, modern. Hotel was difficult to locate because the street is not listed on maps. Find the location before you travel!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: edwina5000
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. Forget what others have said about the little triangle "going a bit seedy" or whatever. It was a very friendly corner of Paris and only 5 minutes from the Metro. Great to step out of the hotel and 1 minute later be in the food/art market on the main road. Really felt like we were in Paris proper and a relatively short and interesting walk from the centre. Didn't find the staff effusive exactly, but certainly friendly, polite and to the point. Certainly no complaints. Worth knowing that they're open 24/7, so it doesn't matter what time you arrive they'll still let you in and hand you your keys. Breakfast is nothing special, but nice to roll out of your room to it. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, location, service”
Reviews.Author: pgwanderer
Reviews.Content: This was my seventh or eighth stay. Even without recent, beautifully done reonnovations, the hotel is a wonderful secret. Conveniently located to metro, restaurants and well-priced, the rooms, while small, are nicely done and well-maintained. Very friendly and accommodating management and staff. Personal touch to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great París”
Reviews.Author: Lux1990
Reviews.Content: Well, I was at Du Parc Hotel, and is not my first time to be there. I came back to this hotel because it is in a great location, very close to metro, Tour Montparnasse, a variety of restaurants... You just have to travel by metro a few minuts to be in front of Eiffel tower. Rooms are cool. You will have good days in París. Paulina _Camarena México 2009

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: maacone
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Very close to transport links, quiet, lots of eating options nearby, helpful staff, pleasant interior, decently-sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: victoriasintention
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Parc is a two minute walk from the Montparnasse train station. It is also walkable to the chic St. Germain area. These two criteria were why I chose this hotel for our stay. The rates were very good for Paris and thankfully we were booked into a room that had just been renovated. It was modern and had an upscale feel although it was tiny. The bathroom was newly renovated, large and clean. The immediate area around the hotel is on the fringe. Nicer restaurants share the block with a couple of porn shops, but it really isn't a big deal. Plus there is a Monoprix at the end of the block. Construction work began about 7:30am as the renovation continues. It reminded me and my husband of the tv commercial where the couple is trying to talk over the jack hammering in the hotel room. Again, no big deal because you leave in the mornings to go enjoy Paris. Free internet in the dining room and a friendly staff round out this place as a value, especially if you get a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably priced hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jeffreymc
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small with modern decor. The room and bathroom were very clean and the location is great. The hotel is a couple of blocks away from 3 different subway stations and surrounded by great restaurants. Only drawback is that the hotel claimed to have A/C but it did not work in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Going back again in November!”
Reviews.Author: SharpeiJane
Reviews.Content: The hotel du Parc is bright, extremely clean, between 2 Metro stops, opposite a Monoprix and there's the most marvelous market right outside the door twice a week - a fabulous opportunity to observe French housewives shop fresh produce! The staff are all friendly and helpful; the rooms were bright and spacious - in Paris terms! This has been our family's preferred area (Montparnasse) for several years; this is the hotel we have re-booked, in fact we booked the dates before we left. Be aware that Reception is one flight of stairs up, not at street level and the lift is tiny but it goes to all floors - from Reception. Our son is a morning grouch, even on hols: on Day 3 the staff anticipated his choice and had it on the table as soon as he came down to breakfast - now that's stress reduction!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Parc Paris; very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: smokeyoriginal
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money, pleasant old hotel, clean, freindly, good area, would definately recomend this to anyone staying in Paris, 10mins metro ride to centre, loved it. Mick B.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-located Small Hotel for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: handhnh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true find! The staff is very congenial and helpful and the neighborhood is very interesting. I asked for a quiet room since that is about the most important thing for me in a hotel and they put us on the top floor. Since Hotel du Paris is located on a tiny street with a park in the center, there is just about no traffic and no motorcycles which is difficult to find in Paris and I could actually leave the window open (a first for me in Paris!). Since we were high up, the views of the roof tops of Paris was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “one night stay”
Reviews.Author: trevojan
Reviews.Content: easy booking on hotel web-site. friendly reception and rooms ready despite arriving early. sons room next to ours and away from other rooms. excellent breakfast with something for my boys to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “I liked very much !! It only need a elevator until first floor !!!”
Reviews.Author: Alrochabb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good and staff are very educated !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excelent location”
Reviews.Author: Timysl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at a promotional price of only 68 EUR per night for a double bed and breakfast included. The hotel is very well located, close to Montparnasse Tower (about 300m), where you can find also the Train, Metro, RER station. If you are too lasy to walk till there, don't worry there is Edgar Quinet Metro station within 200m from the hotel. The personel is very friendly, the rooms are clean and spacious enough. We were impressed to see that we have both bath tub and shower cabin. Maybe the furniture needs a little bit improvement but the bed was big and confortable. The room had an LCD TV, and if you are lucky enough to get a room close to the dinning room, you can have also free WiFi internet connection. Breakfast is also very good (according to french standards). It contains coffee/tea/hot chocolate, one croissant, one baguette with butter and jam and one glass of orrange juice. To reach the hotel from CDG Airport we took the RER B and changed to Metro line 6 at Denfert-Rochereau, until Edgar Quinet Metro Station. Overall this was an excellent experience and if you want to spend the time in the room only for sleeping, I don't see any reason on chosing a more expensive hotel. I will definitely return during my next visit to Paris and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to discover Paris, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Alorac
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the "Hotel du Parc" from Monday to Friday last week and we enjoyed our stay very much. Not only the easy access to both Metro stations Edgar Quinet and Montparnasse Bienvenue as well as to many nice little Cafés and Crèperies was the reason for this. We also had a nice and quiet twin room with good beds, large and clean bathroom with shower and bath all away from the hot sun. The breakfast was average (the jams all tasted the same ;-)) but the service was very courteous (We could even leave our luggage on the day of departure for several hours) We can recommend the hotel and will come back here on our next holiday to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: billSingapore
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in an interesting little neighbourhood (la gaiete) that used to be a hotbed of caberet in the 1920s - one of the streets still has 3 or 4 theatres in it. lots of cafes and restaurants ranging from traditional french family style (bouchon lyonnais genuine quality) to chinese takeaway throught various mulim eateries. several cinemas close and gare montparnasse is nearby. the hotel faces a quiet little park populated occasionally with smokers and winos. accommodation level is basic and rooms are of variable size ranging from poky to small although quite comfortable (includes aircon) if you don't mind worn furniture and carpets. the receptionist during the day never seemed to smile but otherwise the service was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fond of the Hotel du Parc”
Reviews.Author: GigiPortland
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Parc is an excellent value in a convenient location. I love the feel of the neighborhood which is not so touristy but an area where Parisians live and work. There is a Monoprix two minutes from the hotel equipped with a fantastic supermarket. Easy access tot he Montparnasse train station and within walking to distance to Little Brittany, several streets lined with creperies. I've been staying at this hotel since 1995!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tankard13
Reviews.Content: The hotel could have a refrigerator in order to have cool water all day. Nevertheless the room was clean and the people working in the hotel were good and helpful. The hotel is situated near two metro stations which is a serious advantage for someone who wants to see paris

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: PatoCL
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay near Montparnasse at a reasonable price. The Hotel du Parc offered both. I arrived in the Air France bus, who stopped just a couple of blocks from the hotel. The view of the outside was a bit uninviting, because of the renovations, plus you have to go one floor up on foot with your luggage, but the room was comfortable and clean, and so was the bathroom. There was free wifi in the lobby, that reached many of the rooms. Breakfast with croissants and bagettes with butter and jam was served every morning. The hotel is close to metro stations and to many restaurants. I would recommend this to anyone who will spend most of the day out and needs a comfortable place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Central and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: KieranfromGalway
Reviews.Content: Although this family-run hotel was undergoing renovation, that did not interfere with the service (reception and breakfast), which was well above average. The room certainly lacked ambiance but was clean and adequate. I had expected air-conditioning in the bedroom and needed it at times, at least to cool down the room. It offers reasonable value considering its pleasant location facing a little park and its proximity to a metro station, Montparnasse Railway Station and an abundance of restaurants. I would consider staying there again but would check other options also.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Paal61
Reviews.Content: We got one room in new shape with wooden floor and a new bathroom. Everything ok except the safe that didn´t lock. The other room more traditional with carpets on the floor. Planned for renewal of the other rooms, too. We came by the Air France bus from Orly directly to Montparnasse. Perfect timing. Three Metro stations next door. Start your stay in Paris with the best wiev from 59th floor in Tour Montparnasse. From 11:30 pm you can get there for free (you have to pay for the drink in the sky bar, though).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwp48
Reviews.Content: Friendly, small, clean, convenient. In the process of renovation (June 2008 for approx 1 year) but no inconvenience. Free WiFi in lobby but I also had no problem in a top-floor room. Convenient for restaurants etc. Unfortunately the area around the small park has gone a little downhill in the last 10 years or so since I have been going to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: Leon77
Reviews.Content: The rooms have no shower or toilet, but the hotel is very well located in Paris. For short stays(one or two days) I will rate it very good.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Parc
HotelInfo.Address: 6, Rue Jolivet, 75014 Paris, France
